message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;

class TitleApplier {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String name;
        String[] males = {"Elroy", "Fred", "Graham"};
        String[] females = {"Amy", "Buffy", "Cathy"};
        Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);

        while (true) {
            System.out.println("Enter a name: ");
            name = scan.nextLine();
            if (name.equals("")) break;

            StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(name);
            String firstName = st.nextToken();

            boolean isMale = false;
            boolean isFemale = false;

            for (String male : males) {
                if (male.equals(firstName)) {
                    isMale = true;
                    break;
                }
            }

            for (String female : females) {
                if (female.equals(firstName)) {
                    isFemale = true;
                    break;
                }
            }

            if (isMale) {
                System.out.println("Mr. " + name);
            } else if (isFemale) {
                System.out.println("Ms. " + name);
            } else {
                System.out.println(name);
            }
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class is used to break a string into tokens. In this case, we use it to get the first name from the full name entered by the user. We then check if the first name is in the list of male or female names. If it is, we print the name with the appropriate title. If it's not, we print the name as is. The program continues to ask for names until the user enters an empty string.

Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.

Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.
